tasks.title: Refactor JavaScript Code Structure and Organization

tasks.details:

   - Perform a thorough analysis of the existing 3,667-line script.js file
   - Identify logical component boundaries based on functionality
   - Document all global variables, event listeners, and interdependencies
   - Create a dependency graph to understand code relationships

2. Architecture Planning:
   - Design a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns
   - Define module interfaces and communication patterns
   - Plan folder structure for organized code components
   - Create a state management strategy (consider simple pub/sub or observer pattern)

3. Module Creation:
   - Create the following core modules:
     - TabManager: Handle tab switching, state preservation, navigation
     - PreviewManager: Character sheet preview functionality
     - DataManager: Data loading, saving, and validation
     - FormManager: Form field handling and user input processing
     - ValidationManager: Input validation and error reporting
     - UIManager: UI updates and DOM manipulation
     - EventManager: Centralized event handling
     - StateManager: Application state management

4. Modernization:
   - Convert function declarations to arrow functions where appropriate
   - Implement ES6+ features (classes, modules, template literals, destructuring)
   - Replace jQuery with native DOM methods where possible
   - Implement proper Promise-based async/await patterns for AJAX calls
   - Add JSDoc comments for better code documentation

5. Performance Optimizations:
   - Implement debouncing for input handlers and expensive operations
   - Use event delegation for form elements
   - Optimize DOM manipulation with DocumentFragment
   - Implement lazy loading for non-critical components
   - Add request batching for API calls

6. Error Handling:
